DataElement.preferredName: Person Breast Radiation Therapy Complete Randomization Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether radiation therapy to the breast was completed prior to the time of randomization, the allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Breast Radiation Therapy Complete Randomization
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the completion of radiation therapy to the breast with respect to the time of randomization, the allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had whole bre
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had whole breast RT prior to randomization or partial breast RT that cannot be completed on or before the date of randomization?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replace VD Therapy Ind-3 2018278v2.0 with VD ID#3506034 - Yes No Unknown Indicator  - dbw
